home.heroDescription: A frontend-only aquarium logbook to capture tests, events, photos, and spot trends over time.

sprint1.title: Sprint 1
sprint1.description: Page skeletons + coherent navigation (with a mocked “active tank” selector).
bullets: All main routes exist: tanks, tests, photos, events, reminders, settings
Active tank selector is visible in the header (mock list)

tank.title: Tank
tank.description: This will become the main per-tank dashboard (latest values, alerts, charts, photos, and events).

sprint1.title: Sprint 1 skeleton
sprint1.descriptionPrefix: You’re viewing a mocked tank route:
bullets: Read real tanks from the user’s TankLog Drive folder (Sprint 4)
Bring together tests, ranges, and charts here (Sprint 6–9)

unknown.title: Unknown tank
unknown.descriptionPrefix: We don’t recognize this tank id yet:
unknown.body: For Sprint 1 we’re using a temporary mock list. Pick an “Active tank” from the header to navigate to a valid tank page.

tests.title: Water tests
tests.description: Log measurements, review history, and spot trends over time.
tests.comingDescription: In Sprint 1 we’re just building the page skeletons and navigation.
plannedBullets: Add a test (write to Google Sheets)

dialog.title: Add water test (placeholder)
dialog.description: This becomes the real form in Sprint 5. For now, it validates the Dialog primitive (focus, keyboard, escape to close).
dialog.body: Nothing is saved yet — TankLog remains frontend-only and user-controlled.

photos.title: Photos
photos.description: Build a visual timeline of tank progress and compare changes over time.
photos.comingDescription: We’ll upload to Google Drive and store metadata in Google Sheets.

events.title: Events
events.description: Track interventions like water changes, dosing, equipment swaps, and maintenance.
events.comingDescription: Events will be stored in the user’s Google Sheet.

reminders.title: Reminders
reminders.description: Set recurring tasks (water change, dosing, batteries) and get best-effort notifications.
reminders.comingDescription: Reminders will be stored in Sheets and evaluated client-side.
plannedBullets: Notification permission UX (only after user action)

settings.title: Settings
settings.description: Account, language, and TankLog storage live here.

storage.title: Storage (Google Drive)
storage.description: Select your TankLog folder in Google Drive. Until it’s connected, the rest of the app is locked.
storage.label: TankLog folder ID or URL
storage.hint: Paste the TankLog folder link/ID. You can also search for existing “TankLog” folders or create one.

createDialog.title: Create TankLog folder
createDialog.description: TankLog will create a “TankLog” folder in your Drive root. You can move it later if you want.

errors.invalidFolder: Enter a valid Google Drive folder ID or URL.
errors.noFoldersFound: No “TankLog” folders found in your Drive.
errors.createFailed: Failed to create the TankLog folder.

tanks.title: Tanks
tanks.description: Create tanks (Drive folder + per-tank spreadsheet) and select the active one.
tanks.locked: Connect your TankLog Drive folder first.
tanks.listHint: Tanks are discovered from Drive folders inside TankLog.
tanks.empty: No tanks found. Create your first tank to get started.

createDialog.title: Add a new tank
createDialog.description: TankLog will create the tank folder structure and initialize tank_data.xlsx with the required sheets.

errors.invalidVolume: Enter a valid volume in liters.

login.title: Sign in
login.description: TankLog uses Google to access your own Google Sheets + Drive (no backend, no proprietary DB).
login.cardDescription: We’ll request access to Sheets and Drive (folder discovery + files created by TankLog).

errors.missingClientId: Missing Google Client ID. Set NUXT_PUBLIC_GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID and reload.

login.sessionNote: Session is stored in this browser tab (session storage).
